com.example.vybe

Class VibeEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.vybe.Models.VibeEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class VibeEvent
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A class that implements Serializable and keeps track of vibe events. A vibe event is an event triggered by a particular vibe in the form of a Vibe at a particular Date and Time, in the form of a LocalDate object. Every vibe event is kept track of through a unique ID which is passed into and from the FireStore database and also optionally keeps track of other details including a reasoning (in the form of text or a photograph) for the event, and the social situation in which the event occurred in.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • VibeEvent

        public VibeEvent(java.lang.String vibe,
                 java.time.LocalDateTime dateTime,
                 java.lang.String reason,
                 java.lang.String socSit,
                 java.lang.String id,
                 java.lang.String image)
        Default constructor for VibeEvent with provided vibe event parameters
        Parameters:
        vibe - This is the name of the user selected vibe
        dateTime - This is the timestamp in which a vibe event occurs/occurred
        reason - This is the reason a vibe event occurred
        socSit - This is the social situation in which a vibe event occurred
        id - This is the unique identifier for a particular instance of a vibe event
        image - This is a photograph expressing the reason a vibe event occurred
